HAPPY NEW YEAR YOU'Z GITS

Hope you all had the best and greenest holiday break!

We noticed some issues with a few things and wanted to address them quickly:

  • Optimized explosions in the game, so overall performance should be smoother
  • Added list of party members to the HUD (if you're in a party)
Please let us know if you have been positively effected by these fixes, or if you've discovered any new issues!

item.title: December Community Update
item.description:
Dear Space Marines,

The year is coming to an end, and we first and foremost want to assure you that 2025 will be just as epic as 2024. ‚≠ê

You‚Äôve been following our development very closely before and after the release of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, and we‚Äôve loved collaborating with the players to improve the game.
But before we dive into what‚Äôs coming to the game next year, let‚Äôs look back together, shall we?

WARPING BACK TO SEPTEMBER!
We launched Space Marine 2 on September 9 and it was a success! We‚Äôve been working on it for years and it has been a work of passion and dedication. Witnessing the warm welcome the players reserved for the game was the greatest reward and the best achievement to unlock after all these relentless years.

The enthusiasm motivated us to keep up the good work and make sure the game would remain up to the players‚Äô expectations. Then, we released 2 big updates and several hotfixes.

Update 4.0 - Termination ü©∏
Introduced a new PvE mission with a dreadful foe to annihilate: the Hierophant Bio-Titan. This update also introduced the much-awaited photomode in Operations mode, which you loved! Balancing tweaks were made too‚Ä¶


This update received mixed reviews because it increased the difficulty in an unpleasant way. Our mistake! We closely listened to your feedback and released Patch 4.1 a few days later to revert the unwanted effects.
Paying attention to your feedback has been incredibly helpful to us, and it's something we want to continue doing next year.

Update 5.0 - Obelisk ü™Ω
We knew the Warhammer 40k fans were waiting for this one, for it introduced the Dark Angels Cosmetic pack, with the Dark Angels Champion, new weapons skins and more.

This update brought a new PvE map, and also introduced a new enemy: the Tzaangor Enlightened. Along with that, a few feature additions such as the new lens colors (which you‚Äôve also been waiting for) and the Neo-Volkite pistol, available in PvP, were also implemented.
Finally, Space Marine 2 has been upgraded to 4K/60 FPS for PS5 Pro and now supports DLSS3 and FSR3.

More and more Space Marines joining the ranks
In the span of 3 months, Space Marine 2 reached the remarkable milestone of 5 million players, to our great delight. We want to sincerely thank all 5 million of you for this. ü•πüéâ


Fan creations üì∑
Thousands of screenshots from the game were shared on social media (including some striking Titus selfies)
Keep it coming, we love to see it! üì∑


COMMUNITY EVENTS
There will continue to be in-game events in 2025. Currently, the ongoing Decimation Event invites you to win 10 times in Operations in order to unlock an exclusive skin: the Mark XI Hell‚Äôs Teeth Pattern Chainsword. You don‚Äôt want to skip this one, Space Marine, so gear up and head back to the battlefield already! ‚öîÔ∏è

The event starts on December 27 and ends on January 20

WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT FOR 2025?

Fresh content for PVP
PVP Players - We have heard you, and we know you feel left out. We will have your back in 2025 with brand new and exciting content for the PvP. First thing we can tease you with is the new PvP map (it will be set in a closed environment with many narrow passages pushing you to engage more in Closed Quartered Battles).



Custom PvP lobbies will also be implemented in Patch 7.0: You will be able to play with modifiers and change the amount of players, up to 6v6 / You can change the timer limit for each match, the maximum limit score / you can have more than two players for each class (and have 6 snipers on your team if you want, even if it‚Äôs a questionable strategy!)

New PvE content
The hotly anticipated Horde Mode will arrive later in 2025. We‚Äôll keep you updated once we get closer to it!
Prestige Rank will be introduced during season 3, allowing you to upgrade your classes even further.
On top of that, new Operations and new Enemies will come to expand the content of Space Marine 2. To spice things up, a new difficulty level with new rewards will also be added.

And our next Champion will be‚Ä¶ ü•Å
The Salamander Champion!! ü¶é And he will be a sniper, available in PvE and PvP. Let‚Äôs explain our choice a bit:
  1. His cape is very cool (super important).
  2. An obvious choice for the Sniper Champion would have been to be a Raven Guard, but we have different plans for them.
  3. Everyone loves Salamanders, us included, and we really wanted to give them a Champion. Heavy and Tactical would have been good candidates, but Heavy was already taken, and we have a different idea for Tactical.
Here‚Äôs a sneak peek: look at those flames.



Customisation
We‚Äôll keep adding customisation elements (such as the Mark VI Corvus üòâ) throughout the year to represent more iconic Chapters of the Warhammer 40k universe.
Battle Barge Expansion

The Datavault will make its entry on the Battle Barge next year. It will consist of a new area with unlockable information on most elements enemies from the game. Unlock them with a special currency earned through in-game achievements. We‚Äôll get back to you quickly in the beginning of 2025.

Take a first look at it üìö



WE‚ÄôLL SEE YOU SOON, SPACE MARINES
2025 is near, whether or not you‚Äôre celebrating Christmas, we wish you a good end of 2024. Remember celebrating is cool, but protecting the Imperium is better. Don‚Äôt lose focus!
Happy new year gamers. ü•ÇüéÜüéä

Cheers,
Focus & Saber



For the Emperor

item.title: Update 1.3.1.6 is live!
item.description:
Lord Captains, update 1.3.1.6 is live!

It fixes an annoying loading bar bug that used to occur after Eurac-V for Mac, and addresses a number of issues with quests, abilities, items and more.

Please be aware of the plot spoilers below!

Note that https://steamcommunity.com/app/2186680/discussions/0/4027970580228219058/ always contains up-to-date information on known issues and the roadmap of upcoming patches.

Patch Notes

System and stability

  • Loading bar will no longer get stuck after completing Eurac V on MacOS;

Narrative

  • A Lucrative Opportunity quest will now correctly fail upon entering Commorragh;
  • Fixed a problem with the Request and Response quest in Act 1, which could cause the quest to be locked;
  • Sometimes during the Echo of the Past quest, Idira didn't regain her consciousness, causing the quest to be locked - fixed;
  • The quest "Compiler out of Order" couldn't be completed if you interacted with the problem nodes before speaking with the Astropath - fixed;

Mechanics

  • Bounty Hunter's Wild Hunt ability (and its Desperate Measures version) will now have a separate ability for the second weapon (similar to Operative's Dismantling Attack);
  • Bounty Hunter's Withdraw talent no longer provides infinite dodge against all types of attacks;
  • Daemons summoned by Perils of the Warp will no longer spawn in inaccessible areas, preventing random space encounters from ending;
  • Fixed an issue where Kibellah could participate in combat with Chtonos from her cage in the Haemonculus Lab;
  • Fixed some malfunctioning traps across the game that didn't deal damage even when triggered;
  • Some Heroic Acts didn't work if certain types of Heroic Acts or Desperate Measures were used before them - fixed;
  • Uralon in some cases could enter an infinite cycle of attacks - fixed;

Items

  • Many items had descriptions for damage over time effects missing or displaying incorrect numbers - fixed;
  • A couple of items from the Void Shadows DLC were incorrectly awarded to the players without the DLC in colony projects - fixed;
  • Ancient Force Sword damage reduction was applying to all damage types instead of the specific types only - fixed;
  • The Bead of Concentration worked incorrectly. The additional AP was not properly lost or gained in some situations - fixed;
  • Bonuses from Prey Scanner are now correctly calculated when used by Bounty Hunters;
  • Damage bonus of The Distortion and Awakened Nightmare is now correctly only applied to area attacks;
  • Dark Providence and Incinerator no longer require purchasing the DLC to become available from vendors;
  • Familial Power Armour can now be received from the "Call to Arms" level 4 project at Dargonus;
  • Renunciation of Weakness now correctly triggers only on critical hits;
  • Veilrender's damage bonus now correctly applies only to the attacks made with the weapon;

Locations

  • Fixed some camera issues at Commorragh Arena;
  • It was sometimes possible to get stuck without the button to leave the location at Vheabos-6 - fixed;
  • It's no longer possible to enter a version of the Temple of the Bloodspun Web fully devoid of people, making it impossible to complete the quests inside. If you experienced this before the update, leave the location and come back to refresh its state;
  • The cutscene at the Wasteland Wayfarer no longer sometimes plays twice;

Visual

  • After breaking up with Cassia, the visual effects of her mood remained on the screen - while somewhat expected from a sad and angry Navigator, it was a bug and was fixed;
  • Fixed minor texture issues with the Leman Russ tanks;
  • Khorne Bloodletters sometimes had missing textures - fixed;
  • The veil now restores correctly after the battle in the Astropathic Chapel;

UI

  • Torpedo overtips now have less overlap with the torpedoes themselves;
  • Added images to the weapon equipping tutorial;
  • Continue Game button in the main menu didn't work for Grim Darkness saves - fixed;
  • Weapon sets will now switch correctly when on the Voidship Bridge;
  • When playing with a controller or on console, scrolling between torpedoes and fighters caused their cooldown to refresh - fixed, no more endless torpedoes;

Audio

  • Made flute sound louder at the Freight Line;
  • One of the Idira's lines during her recruitment in the prologue that was voiced before 1.3, stopped playing after the 1.3 patch - fixed;

Space

  • Minor UI and rewards fixes for some colony events;
  • Torpedoes now have mini-portraits in the initiative tracker;

Co-op

  • A player can no longer edit the other player's ability bar during their turn in co-op, which could cause desyncs;

Localization
  • Fixed inconsistent Russian translation of force and power weapons - each type now correctly uses its own separate term;
  • Fixed incorrect formatting for Turkish localization;
  • Fixed some untranslated lines for Turkish localization;
  • Message of the Day has received a Turkish translation;
  • Russian translation of Scorpion Chainsword was corrected;
  • Immolate The Soul had incorrect description in Chinese - fixed;
